name: Tense, aspect, result-state, completion
description: How actions unfold in time: ongoing, completed, resulting states, doing in advance, trying, finishing, and trends.

entries.meaning: progressive/state; habitual
entries.example_jp: 今、雨が降っている。
entries.example_en: It is raining now.
notes_grammar: Vている = ongoing action OR resulting state depending on verb (e.g., 結婚している).

entries.meaning: resulting state (intentional action done)
entries.example_jp: 机の上に資料が置いてある。
entries.example_en: The materials have been placed on the desk.
notes_grammar: Often implies someone intentionally did it; focus on state/result.

entries.meaning: finish completely / unfortunately do / regretful completion
entries.example_jp: 宿題を忘れてしまいました。
entries.example_en: I unfortunately forgot my homework.
notes_grammar: Can mean completion or regret/undesirable outcome depending on context.

entries.meaning: do in advance / do beforehand in preparation for something
entries.example_jp: 旅行の前にホテルを予約しておきます。
entries.example_en: I will reserve the hotel in advance before the trip.

entries.meaning: leave something as is / remain in a resulting state
entries.example_jp: 電気をつけたまま寝てしまいました。
entries.example_en: I fell asleep with the lights left on.

entries.meaning: try doing; do and see
entries.example_jp: この薬を飲んでみます。
entries.example_en: I'll try taking this medicine.

entries.meaning: finish doing
entries.example_jp: レポートを書き終わりました。
entries.example_en: I finished writing the report.

entries.meaning: do in advance; have done
entries.example_jp: 明日の会議の資料を印刷しておいた。
entries.example_en: I printed the meeting materials in advance.

entries.meaning: ended up doing; regrettably did
entries.example_jp: 財布を忘れてしまった。
entries.example_en: I ended up forgetting my wallet.

entries.meaning: be in the process of; be on the way to (formal)
entries.example_jp: 人口は減りつつある。
entries.example_en: The population is decreasing.

entries.meaning: about to / in the middle of / just did
entries.example_jp: 今から出かけるところです。
entries.example_en: I'm just about to go out.
notes_grammar: Vるところだ=about to; Vているところだ=in the middle; Vたところだ=just did.

entries.meaning: only continue to; do nothing but (often negative trend)
entries.example_jp: 物価は上がるばかりだ。
entries.example_en: Prices keep rising.

entries.meaning: there are times when; have experience of
entries.example_jp: 電車が遅れることがあります。
entries.example_en: There are times when trains are delayed.

entries.meaning: leave; keep as is for now
entries.example_jp: そのままにしておいてください。
entries.example_en: Please leave it as it is for now.

entries.meaning: done and left for a purpose
entries.example_jp: 飲み物が冷やしてあります。
entries.example_en: Drinks have been chilled (ready).

entries.meaning: tend to end up doing
entries.example_jp: 夜更かししてしまいがちだ。
entries.example_en: I tend to stay up late.

entries.pattern: 〜てしょうがない / 〜てたまらない
entries.meaning: can't help but; extremely (feeling)
entries.example_jp: 会いたくてたまらない。
entries.example_en: I can't stand how much I want to see you.

entries.meaning: can't help but; very
entries.example_jp: 心配でしかたがない。
entries.example_en: I can't help but worry.

entries.meaning: can't help but; very (often written)
entries.example_jp: 残念でならない。
entries.example_en: I can't help but feel it's regrettable.

entries.meaning: was just in the middle of
entries.example_jp: ちょうど出かけているところでした。
entries.example_en: I was just in the middle of going out.

entries.meaning: with the intention of; acting as if
entries.example_jp: 冗談のつもりで言った。
entries.example_en: I said it intending it as a joke.

entries.meaning: leave (something) as is; keep doing
entries.example_jp: ドアを開けっぱなしにしないで。
entries.example_en: Don't leave the door open.
